TOUCH(1) General Commands Manual TOUCH(1)

NAME

touch — change file access and modification times

SYNOPSIS

touch [-achm] [-r file] [-t [[CC]YY]MMDDhhmm[.ss]] [-d time] [--time=word] file ...

DESCRIPTION

The touch utility sets the access and modification times of files. If any file does not exist, it is created with default permissions.

By default, the touch utility changes both the access and modification times. The -a and -m flags may be used to select the access time or the modification time individually. Selecting both is equivalent to the default.

The following options are available:

-a
Change the access time of the file. The modification time of the file is not changed unless the -m flag is also specified.
-c, --no-create
Do not create the file if it does not exist. The touch utility does not treat this as an error. No error messages are displayed and the exit value is not affected.
-d, --date=time
Parse the provided human-readable time and use it instead of the current time. (Not yet implemented in vibeutils)
-h, --help
Display help information and exit.
-m
Change the modification time of the file. The access time of the file is not changed unless the -a flag is also specified.
-r, --reference=file
Use the access and modification times from the specified file instead of the current time.
-t [[CC]YY]MMDDhhmm[.ss]
Change the access and modification times to the specified time instead of the current time. The argument is of the form “[[CC]YY]MMDDhhmm[.ss]” where each pair of letters represents the following:

CC
The first two digits of the year (the century).
YY
The second two digits of the year. If “YY” is specified, but “CC” is not, a value for “YY” between 69 and 99 results in a “CC” value of 19. Otherwise, a “CC” value of 20 is used.
MM
The month of the year, from 01 to 12.
DD
The day of the month, from 01 to 31.
hh
The hour of the day, from 00 to 23.
mm
The minute of the hour, from 00 to 59.
ss
The second of the minute, from 00 to 59.
--time=word
Change the specified time: word is one of access, atime, use (equivalent to -a); modify or mtime (equivalent to -m).
-V, --version
Display version information and exit.

EXIT STATUS

The touch utility exits 0 on success, and >0 if an error occurs.

EXAMPLES

Create or update a file with the current timestamp:

$ touch file.txt

Update multiple files without creating them if they don't exist:

$ touch -c file1.txt file2.txt file3.txt

Set specific timestamps for a file:

$ touch -t 202312251200.00 christmas.txt

Copy timestamps from one file to another:

$ touch -r source.txt target.txt

Update only the access time:

$ touch -a accessed.txt

SEE ALSO

chmod(1), stat(1), utimensat(2)

STANDARDS

The touch utility is expected to be IEEE Std 1003.2 (“POSIX.2”) compatible.

HISTORY

A touch utility appeared in Version 7 AT&T UNIX.

AUTHORS

This implementation of touch for vibeutils was written by Claude.

December 31, 2023 macOS 15.6
